Text:
I appreciate the upload. Can someone please help me out with the sound? I assume I am missing something, and that the rip is an awesome one. A few simple instructions would be excellent. Thanks again!
- m

s_f_s, as stated in the nfo, the audio codec is AC3. This is available from sourceforge (http://sourceforge.net/projects/ac3filter) or it comes in any of the major codec packs. Alternately you can download VLC Player (http://www.videolan.org/vlc) which contains it's own playback filters, to view the video.

Maelstrom,

Thank you very much. I should have specified that I was using an Intel Mac. A simple google search easily got me what I needed. Here is a very convenient codec bundle for Quick Time users.

http://blog.twenty08.com/2006/12/27/codec-pack-for-all-the-new-mac-users/

On second thought, I'd really like it if the volume was a bit louder. Is there something I can do to adjust the volume of the files my altering the metadata of them, like I would to change the tag on an mp3?

I do not know with a MAC, for a PC the AC3 codec allows you to adjust the gain.
Example -- (http://imageupload.se/files/080225/9029ac3confic.PNG)
